intro: Phalangium vespertinum, commonly known as the evening fingerling, is a species of millipede belonging to the order Polydesmida. It is characterized by its elongated, segmented body and numerous pairs of legs, typical of millipedes. This species is often found in moist, forested environments where it plays a role in decomposing organic matter. Its exoskeleton is covered in a waxy cuticle that helps retain moisture in its habitat. Phalangium vespertinum is nocturnal, becoming active during the evening and nighttime hours.
